resources.string: The offensive line is comprised of 5 people. It has 2 tackles, 2 guards, and 1 center. th order in which they are present is left tackle, left guard, center, right guard, right tackle.

The blocking scheme that a offensive line must execute is determined by the play call. There are 7 base types of blocking schemes including inside zone, outside zone, power, counter, pass pro, screens, and draws. While these are base types there are variations with subtle differences

With offensive line being the one of the most cooperative positions in any sport combinations are a key component of each players skills. Often when performing a combination block, the goal is to drive the initial defensive lineman back to a linebacker. However there are instances where you will do a combination block against only one person and this is called a combination kill block since it is intended to dominate a defensive lineman. There are instances where you will do a combination kill block against highly skilled defensive lineman to even the playing field but these instances are rare.

What separates good and great offensive lineman is the ability to read a defense. defenses tend to fall into 2 categories, 3 down and 4 down. This talks about the number of defensive lineman on the line of scrimmage. The alignment of the 3/4 defensive lineman also matters as this can give you and idea as to what the rest of the defense is doing; the variety of alignments is numerous so we will only cover a few in a later topic.
